Dependency management is a core feature of NuGet. Managing dependencies for a single project can be easy. Managing dependencies for multi-project solutions can prove to be...

FeedItems.Title: Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet.org will begin requiring two-factor authentication for accounts starting March 8th.
The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: NuGet API return Blob was not found" (#9111) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
@kalirajanganeshan commented on [Wed Apr 27 2022](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/11780)

### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

Syncfusion Blazor Version API

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Repro Steps & Context

We try to get the versions of our package using following NuGet API. It was return as blob was not founded but the package was exists in NuGet.Org.

API URL : https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/PackageName/index.json

Result:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87634016/165754482-b166de4f-026b-4ea1-abd0-8e8805e236b3.png)

Note: The issue was not occurred in all machine and it was only occurred in some machines only. Could you please check and update?


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" (#11785) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

Windows 7 (6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 Build 7601)/ dotnet.exe/ VS2019 (16.11.11)/ nuget package manager (5.11.0)

### Worked before?

Cannot determine last known working version

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

## Using Package Management UI on Visual Studio 2019:
Searching for a package on the browse UI section
Expected Result:
A list of packages or one package shows
Actual Result:
[Screenshots](https://imgur.com/a/NkYaDgz)

## Using Package Manager Console on Visual Studio 2019:
Adding "RestSharp" package
Expected Result:
package installs successfully
Actual Result:
[Screenshot](https://imgur.com/a/LKqBGdI)

## Using dotnet via cmd:
Adding "RestSharp" package
Expected Result:
package installs successfully
Actual Result:
[Screenshot](https://imgur.com/a/8pRd9zn)

## Additional Information:
* Browsing [index.json](https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json) on Chrome works!
* Tried to apply some registry fixes following this blog [devblogs.microsoft](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org/)  without success

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: RestoreLockedMode fails when overriding reference from Directory.Builds.prop" (#11776) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.202

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work.

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Run `dotnet new console`
2. Replace the project file contents with the following

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>net6.0</TargetFramework>
    <ImplicitUsings>enable</ImplicitUsings>
    <Nullable>enable</Nullable>

    <RestoreLockedMode>true</RestoreLockedMode>
    <RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile>
    <DisableImplicitNuGetFallbackFolder>true</DisableImplicitNuGetFallbackFolder>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection" Version="6.0.0" />
  </ItemGroup>

</Project>
```

3. Run `dotnet restore`
4. Note that `packages.lock.json` specifies version `6.0.0` of `Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection`
5. Create `Directory.Build.props` with the following contents

```xml
<Project>
  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection" Version="5.0.0" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

6. Run `dotnet restore`

EXPECTED: 

Operation completes successfully. `packages.lock.json` continues to use version of `6.0.0` of `Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection`

ACTUAL:

Receive error message: 

> C:\temp\RestoreIssue\RestoreIssue.csproj : error NU1004: The package reference Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection version has changed from [6.0.0, ) to [5.0.0, ).The packages lock file is inconsistent with the project dependencies so restore can't be run in locked mode. Disable the RestoreLockedMode MSBuild property or pass an explicit --force-evaluate option to run restore to update the lock file.

### Verbose Logs

[log.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/8565927/log.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: global.json reader fails to parse file with anything but a leading StartObject (curly brace)" (#11784) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

17.2.0

### Worked before?

Yes, 17.1

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Use a `global.json` with a leading comment or not a `{`:

```json
// A comment
{
  "msbuild-sdks": {
    "Microsoft.Build.NoTargets" : "3.3.0"
  }
}
```

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Nuget SDK Resolver support for wildcard characters" (#11783) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "[Bug]: NuGet does not retry some HTTP timeouts" (#11779) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

dotnet 7.0 previews

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

NuGet's `HttpRetryHandler` has a `catch (OperationCancelledException) { throw; }` block in order to not retry when the input `cancellationToken` requests cancellation. However, `HttpClient` throws `OperationCancelledException` for some timeouts. This should be handled correctly with a `when (cancellationToken.IsCancellationRequested)` filter.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org" (#61) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: We announced plans to require tFA on all accounts on NuGet.org. Details in the [blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/requiring-two-factor-authentication-on-nuget-org/).
